In an experiment, two blocks made of different materials are placed on the same wooden board, which is initially horizontal. The table shown provides three values for each block: the mass, the area of the side of the block in contact with the board, and the coefficient of static friction between the block and the board. One end of the board is then slowly raised. Which of the following correctly identifies the block that will start sliding down the board first, and includes appropriate reasoning?

choices.label: Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because it has less mass per unit area.
Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the coefficient of static friction is smaller.
Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because it has greater mass.
Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the coefficient of static friction is larger.

content.answer: Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the coefficient of static friction is smaller.
